EventExplicitOriginalTarget.summary: The read-only explicitOriginalTarget property of the interface returns the non-anonymous original target of the event.

remarks.para: If the event was retargeted for some reason other than an anonymous boundary crossing, this will be set to the target before the retargeting occurs.

For example, mouse events are retargeted to their parent node when they happen over text nodes (see Webkit bug 185889), and in that case currentTarget will show the parent while this property will show the text node.
This property also differs from originalTarget in that it will never contain anonymous content.

EventExplicitOriginalTarget.value: Returns the object, or null if there isn't one.
